title: Pete Buttigieg
deleted: In January 2019, Buttigieg launched the South Bend Home Repair initiative. This expanded the existing South Bend Home Repair Pilot, which helps make available funds to assist residents with home repairs, through the use of $600,000 in city funding (double what the city had earlier pledged to the program) and $300,000 in [[block grants]].<ref name=jan152019>{{cite web |last1=Bauer |first1=Caleb |title=South Bend officials highlight home repair programs |url=https://www.southbendtribune.com/news/local/south-bend-officials-highlight-home-repair-programs/article_f6cc225b-d89e-5bb0-9a17-7f6bff70255f.html |newspaper=South Bend Tribune |access-date=November 16, 2019 |date=January 15, 2019}}</ref> He also created two new programs. The first of these is the South Bend Green Corps, which makes funds available to lower-income homeowners for such uses as energy-saving measures and basic weatherization, the installation of [[Smoke detector|smoke]] and [[Carbon monoxide detector|carbon monoxide]] detectors, lead tests, and energy bill review. It also provides education on reducing energy bills.<ref name=jan152019/> The South Bend Green Corps was funded with $290,000 from the city and $150,000 from [[AmeriCorps]].<ref name=jan152019/> The second program is Love Your Block, which assists citizen groups and local nonprofits in revitalizing neighborhoods, and which was funded with $25,000 from the city and $25,000 from the nonprofit Cities of Service.<ref name=jan152019/>

title: Pete Buttigieg
deleted: During Buttigieg's tenure, the city's police force continued to struggle with a high homicide rate; the annual number of murders in South Bend was 18 in 2012, 9 in 2013, 17 in 2014, 7 in 2015, 14 in 2016, 15 in 2017, and 13 in 2018.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.abc57.com/news/south-bend-murder-count-remains-steady-under-buttigiegs-watch|title=South Bend's murder count remains in double digits under most of Buttigieg's watch|newspaper=[[WBND-LD]]|date=April 14, 2019}}</ref>

title: Pete Buttigieg
added: On April 14, 2011, before Buttigieg took office as mayor, Jiha'd Vasquez, a 16-year-old black boy, was found hanging from an electrical tower.<ref name=TYT>{{Cite web |url=https://tyt.com/stories/4vZLCHuQrYE4uKagy0oyMA/5iMSC8eiu3XG1HVYHEvv5 |title=Mother of Black Teen Who Was Hanged Says Buttigieg Wouldn't Help |date=May 23, 2019 |last=Harrell |first=Jeff |website=[[The Young Turks]] |access-date=January 22, 2021}}</ref><ref name=ActivistsDemand>{{Cite web |url=https://www.abc57.com/news/community-activists-demand-outside-review-of-local-death-investigations |title=Community activists demand outside review of local death investigations |date=August 28, 2012 |website=[[WBND-LD|ABC57]] |access-date=January 22, 2021}}</ref> Vasquez's backpack, on the ground near his body, had several items missing, according to Vasquez's mother Stephanie Jones.<ref name=TYT /> The coroner, Chuck Hurley, who had no medical experience, claimed Vasquez's death was a suicide; Buttigieg later appointed Hurley to serve as interim police chief.<ref name=TYT /> Vasquez's body was cremated without an autopsy being conducted.<ref name=TYT /> Jones attempted to get Buttigieg to investigate her son's death, but he did not, fearing "potential political risks."<ref name=TYT /> According to Jones, Buttigieg told her to call his office, but she never got a response.<ref name=TYT /> When Buttigieg's presidential campaign was asked about the incident by a reporter in 2019, they did not give a response.<ref name=TYT />

title: Pete Buttigieg
added: | spouse              = {{marriage|[[Chasten Buttigieg|Chasten Glezman]]<!-- Public figure infoxboxes use spouse's name prior to marriage -->|June 16, 2018}}

title: Pete Buttigieg
added: | spouse              = {{marriage|[[Chasten Buttigieg]]<!-- Public figure infoxboxes use spouse's name prior to marriage -->|June 16, 2018}}

On April 14, 2011, before Buttigieg took office as mayor, Jiha'd Vasquez, a 16-year-old black boy, was found hanging from an electrical tower.<ref name=TYT>{{Cite web |url=https://tyt.com/stories/4vZLCHuQrYE4uKagy0oyMA/5iMSC8eiu3XG1HVYHEvv5 |title=Mother of Black Teen Who Was Hanged Says Buttigieg Wouldn't Help |date=May 23, 2019 |last=Harrell |first=Jeff |website=[[The Young Turks]] |access-date=January 22, 2021}}</ref><ref name=ActivistsDemand>{{Cite web |url=https://www.abc57.com/news/community-activists-demand-outside-review-of-local-death-investigations |title=Community activists demand outside review of local death investigations |date=August 28, 2012 |website=[[WBND-LD|ABC57]] |access-date=January 22, 2021}}</ref> Vasquez's backpack, on the ground near his body, had several items missing, according to Vasquez's mother Stephanie Jones.<ref name=TYT /> The coroner, Chuck Hurley, who had no medical experience, claimed Vasquez's death was a suicide; Buttigieg later appointed Hurley to serve as interim police chief.<ref name=TYT /> Vasquez's body was cremated without an autopsy being conducted.<ref name=TYT /> Jones attempted to get Buttigieg to investigate her son's death, but he did not, fearing "potential political risks."<ref name=TYT /> According to Jones, Buttigieg told her to call his office, but she never got a response.<ref name=TYT /> When Buttigieg's presidential campaign was asked about the incident by a reporter in 2019, they did not give a response.<ref name=TYT />

title: Pete Buttigieg

title: Pete Buttigieg
added: ====Pedestrian Safety====

Buttigieg noted that the United States' actions surrounding [[Road traffic safety|road traffic safety]] is lacking and encouraged the improved design of roads. He also encouraged a shift in the policy from [[Pedestrian safety through vehicle design|decisions based on cars]] to decisions based on human actions. <ref>https://www.itsinternational.com/its17/its8/news/buttigieg-us-falls-short-pedestrian-safety</ref>

title: Pete Buttigieg
added: ====Gateway Rail Tunnel Project====

Buttigieg informed Congress that the administration was planning to prioritize the construction of the [[Gateway Program (Northeast Corridor)|Gateway Rail Tunnel Project]] due to its economic significance. <ref>https://www.crainsnewyork.com/transportation/nyc-nj-tunnel-plan-has-sense-urgency-buttigieg-says</ref>

The progress of the project, which was stalled by [[Donald Trump|President Trump]]<ref>https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-03-25/buttigieg-says-gateway-tunnel-planning-is-progressing</ref>, was announced to be moving faster, according to New York [[United States Senate|senator]], [[Chuck Schumer]]. Buttigieg announced the [[Environmental impact assessment|evironmental impact assessment]] of the project - which was largely seen as a sign of major progress in the project. <ref>https://newyork.cbslocal.com/2021/03/26/gateway-tunnel-project-biden-administration/</ref>
